name: 01-Project-Overview
content:
Equipment-Predictive-Maintenance


Objective:

The Equipment Predictive Maintenance project aims to develop a machine learning-driven solution that forecasts potential engine equipment failures before they occur. By leveraging historical sensor data, equipment specifications, condition metrics, and operational status, the system empowers businesses to adopt proactive maintenance strategies, minimize unplanned downtime, and extend asset lifecycles for field-installed engines.


ï»¿Approach:

The solution is built through a structured data science pipeline involving:

  • Data Ingestion & Preparation
  • Load and clean engine data including sensor readings, status logs, and maintenance records.
  • Normalize and enrich with calculated features (e.g., time since installation, vibration trends).
  • Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)
  • Analyze distributions across:
  • Equipment specs (Make, Model, Category, Serial Number)
  • Condition & criticality codes
  • Replacement cost and lifecycle indicators
  • Operational status (Working vs Not Working)
  • Predictive Modeling using H2O
  • Train ML models to predict maintenance needs based on past failures and sensor behavior.
  • Validate model performance and extract feature importance.
  • Interactive Dashboards
  • Build dashboards for:
  • Failure likelihood by category
  • Condition distribution analysis
  • Replacement cost patterns
  • Maintenance flag monitoring by engine


Significance:

  • Enables predictive maintenance aligned to real-world risks, replacing costly reactive strategies.
  • Supports asset managers in identifying vulnerable equipment types for prioritization.
  • Helps reduce maintenance overhead, prevent critical failures, and extend operational uptime.
  • Aligns maintenance actions with data-driven thresholds, not static schedules.


Expected Outcome:

  • A validated predictive model that flags engines likely to need attention.
  • Deployment-ready, scalable visual dashboards for failure risk analysis and asset monitoring.
  • Integration with field operations, allowing planners and technicians to make timely decisions.
